question: The radius of the incircle of the equilateral triangle having each side 6 cm is
explanation: E = In-center, AD ⊥ BC AB = 6 cm, BD = 3 cm ∠ADB = 90° ∴ AD = $latex \\sqrt{AB^{2} - BD^{2}}$ $latex => \\sqrt{6^{2}-3^{2}} = \\sqrt{36-9}$ $latex => \\sqrt{27} = 3\\sqrt{3}cm$ ∴ In-radius = $latex \\frac{1}{3}&s=1$$latex AD$ $latex =>\\frac{1}{3}\\times 3\\sqrt{3}&s=1$ $Latex = \\sqrt{3}cm$ Hence option [B] is the right answer.
